summary: This document is a series of email exchanges from 2019-2020 between Assistant U.S. Attorney Alex and Edward Tyrrell, with others copied, requesting travel approval for the Epstein investigation team (case 2018R01618) to conduct victim interviews in Los Angeles, West Palm Beach, Fort Lauderdale, and near Stockholm, Sweden. It reveals the ongoing investigative activity after Epstein's arrest.

persons.name: Alex
persons.context: The primary sender of the emails, repeatedly requesting travel approval for the investigation team to conduct interviews in various locations for the Epstein case.

persons.name: Edward Tyrrell
persons.context: The recipient of the travel approval requests, addressed as 'Ed', who grants approval for the investigative travel.

persons.name: Darlene Alleyne
persons.context: Consistently copied on the travel approval request emails, indicating her involvement in the administrative or oversight process.

persons.name: Maurene
persons.context: Named as a potential traveler for victim interviews in West Palm Beach and Los Angeles as part of the Epstein investigation team.

persons.name: Alison
persons.context: Named as a potential traveler for victim interviews in West Palm Beach and Los Angeles as part of the Epstein investigation team.

persons.name: Michele Duncan
persons.context: Copied on some of the earlier travel approval request emails in 2019.

connections.description: Alex submits travel approval requests to Edward Tyrrell, who approves them, indicating a supervisor-subordinate or requester-approver dynamic within the U.S. Attorney's office.
Darlene Alleyne is consistently copied on Alex's travel requests, suggesting she is part of the administrative chain or oversight for the investigation's logistics.
Alex and Maurene are mentioned as traveling together or as part of the same team to conduct victim interviews for the Epstein investigation.
Alex and Alison are mentioned as traveling together or as part of the same team to conduct victim interviews for the Epstein investigation.
Both are listed as potential travelers and team members for the same investigative trips to interview victims.

events.title: Planned LA Interview
events.description: The investigation team plans to conduct at least one interview in Los Angeles.

events.title: Planned Sweden Interview
events.description: The investigation team requests travel to conduct an interview near Stockholm, Sweden, indicating the international scope of the probe.

events.title: West Palm Beach Interview
events.description: Alex and Maurene plan to travel to West Palm Beach, Florida, to conduct a victim interview.

events.title: Travel Approval Granted
events.description: Edward Tyrrell approves a travel request from Alex and Alison for meetings and interviews in West Palm Beach related to United States v. Epstein.

keyFacts: The document references the ongoing federal investigation 'United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618', described as 'an investigation relating to enticement of minors for sexual activity'.
Investigative travel for victim interviews continued actively from at least March 2019 through February 2020, spanning multiple U.S. cities and an international location (Sweden).
The investigation team, including AUSA Alex and colleagues Alison and Maurene, conducted interviews requiring hotel conference rooms, suggesting formal, possibly multi-witness proceedings.
Travel requests were subject to an approval process involving Edward Tyrrell and oversight from officials like Darlene Alleyne and Michele Duncan.
The international trip to Sweden in January 2020 highlights the investigation's efforts to gather evidence or testimony outside the United States.
